title: Diploma in Solar Photovoltaics: Principles, Technologies & Materials
headline: In this free online course learn about the principles, technologies and materials used in solar photovoltaics.
description: In this free online course, you will learn about solar energy, solar cells, solar radiation the fundamental aspects of solar radiation, the atmospheric effects on solar radiation, and measuring sunrise and sunset. Start the course to find out more about measuring solar radiation, the basics of P-N junctions and the effects of bias, the characteristics of P-N junctions, manufacturing silicon and the generations of PV technologies.
courseDescription:
In this free online course, you will learn about learn about the principles, technologies and materials used in solar photovoltaics. The course will introduce you to solar energy, solar cells, solar radiation, the fundamental aspects of solar radiation, and identifying atmospheric effects on solar radiation. You will also learn about the effect of location on time, and measuring the Sun-Earth angular rotations.

Next, the course teaches you about the energy band diagram in semi-conductors, and the concept of carrier diffusion. You learn about the basics of P-N junctions including topics such as the characteristics of P-N junctions, forward and reverse bias on P-N junction devices, the effects of bias on P-N junctions, and determining I-V characteristics in dark and light / under illumination.

Finally, the course covers the manufacture of silicon, as well as the first, second and third generations of solar PV technologies. You will also be introduced to the manufacturing processes of various types of solar cells and issues involved in making organic solar cells including cadmium telluride solar cells, bilayer solar cells, multijunction solar cells, perovskite solar cells and CZTS solar cells. Start the course today and learn about the principles, technologies and materials used in solar photovoltaics.
